paper.title: Portfolio Rebalancing Model Utilizing Support Vector Machine for Optimal Asset Allocation
paper.abstract: Achieving an optimal asset allocation strategy is critical for investors aiming to maximize returns while managing risk in a dynamic financial market. This research presents a portfolio rebalancing model that leverages the power of Support Vector Machine (SVM) algorithms to optimize asset allocation decisions and enhance portfolio performance. For this purpose, initially, the assets are classified based on the SVM technique to identify the most favorable assets. Secondly, a widely accepted mean-variance optimization technique is employed by this method to balance risk and return objectives, accommodating diverse transaction costs, time horizons, and other realistic conditions, thus facilitating the selection of assets and their respective weights for both initial investment and the rebalancing of the existing portfolio. Further, to assess the effectiveness of the portfolio rebalancing model incorporating SVM, comprehensive historical testing and performance analyses are conducted using historical data from the Indian Stock Market. This evaluation is contrasted with outcomes derived from other prevalent machine learning techniques such as K-Nearest Neighbors, Naive Bayes, Random Forest, and Decision Tree. By comparing the results from different methodologies, the study highlights the superior efficacy of the SVM-based portfolio rebalancing model in achieving optimal asset allocation in a dynamic financial landscape.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心技术是使用支持向量机（SVM）进行资产分类和均值-方差优化，以实现投资组合的再平衡和最优资产配置。这些技术和方法直接应用于投资组合管理领域，旨在最大化回报并管理风险。
